title: Executive Order 8949-Exemption of Burt W. Andrews From Compulsory Retirement for Age
content: Whereas, in my judgment, the public interest requires that Burt W. Andrews, principal attorney, Bureau of Internal Revenue, Treasury Department, who, during the current month, will reach the retirement age prescribed for automatic separation from the service, applicable to him, be exempted from compulsory retirement for age for a period of one year:

Now, Therefore, by virtue of and pursuant to the authority vested in me by section 204 of the act of June 30, 1932, 47 Stat. 382, 404 (U.S.C., title 5, sec. 715a), I hereby exempt the said Burt W. Andrews from compulsory retirement for age for a period of one year ending November 30, 1942.
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 8949-Exemption of Burt W. Andrews From Compulsory Retirement for Age Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/371704
